page.title: 15FARMING LIFE
page.content: { The Farmbuildings were built in a square traditional style in the late 18th century. This provided shelter. It used to be a Dairy Farm because it is more convenient for the farmer who has a seperate potato business. Dairying put too many restrictions in the 50s and 60s. One of the buildings is the old horse stables which housed 5 Clydesdale horses. Above it is the {Hay Loft.}The farmer changed from dairying 16 years ago and part of the byre is now used for testing the beef cattle for T.B and Brucellcas. This is something they do by law when the cattle reach the age of 18 months. You can still see the overhead pipes which takes the milk into the dairy and then into the milk tank. In the old days they used to milk by hand.
